title: Add Pollinations.AI as a generative AI resource for students
body:
## Description
This PR adds Pollinations.AI as a free generative AI resource for students learning machine learning. It introduces a new section "Generative AI Tools and Resources" to complement the existing course content.

### Added Components:
1. New section in the table of contents for "Generative AI Tools and Resources"
2. Detailed description of Pollinations.AI with its key features for students:
   - No signup required
   - No API key needed
   - Free to use
   - Multiple modalities (text, image, audio)
   - OpenAI-compatible API
   - Educational focus

### Why Pollinations.AI is valuable for ML students:
- **Hands-on learning**: Students can immediately experiment with generative AI models without setup barriers
- **Practical application**: Complements theoretical course content with practical tools
- **Accessibility**: Free access makes it ideal for educational settings
- **API experience**: Students can learn industry-standard API patterns
- **Prompt engineering practice**: Provides a platform to test and refine prompts

This addition enhances the repository by providing students with a practical tool to experiment with the generative AI concepts they learn about in the courses listed in this repository.

## Checklist
- [x] Added new section to the table of contents
- [x] Created detailed description of Pollinations.AI with educational benefits
- [x] Maintained consistent formatting with the rest of the README
- [x] Added relevant links to the platform and documentation

title: Add DGM courses
body:
Created a section for courses on **Deep Generative Models**.
Moved the _Deep Unsupervised Learning_  course to this section as it is a better fit (it previously belonged to the deep learning courses).
I also added 3 new courses on DGM from Cornell, Stanford, and MIT.

title: add Deep Learning for Coders by Fast.AI
body:
**Fast.AI Practical Deep Learning for Coders**
To learn applied DL from 0 to hero. After finishing this course you will know:

- Computer vision, including image classification
- Natural language processing (NLP), including document classification
- Collaborative filtering
- How to turn your models into web applications
- Why and how deep learning models work
- How to implement stochastic gradient descent and a complete training loop from scratch
- How to think about the ethical implications of your work
- 
üîó [Link to Course](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLfYUBJiXbdtRL3FMB3GoWHRI8ieU6FhfM)

title: Add separate note sheets for each of the sections/lectures
Columbia University : Natural Language Processing ADDED
Course: Introduction to Machine Learning with scikit-learn
body:
Hello! Before I submit a PR, I wanted to ask if you would be interested in adding my ML course?

Playlist: [Introduction to Machine Learning with scikit-learn](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL5-da3qGB5ICeMbQuqbbCOQWcS6OYBr5A)

It has 2.1 million views across the 11 videos. If you'd like to read some of the comments people have left about the course, please scroll to the "Comments from my students" section on [this page](https://courses.dataschool.io/introduction-to-machine-learning-with-scikit-learn). (That page also lists all of the topics that are covered in the course.)

It is not a recent course, since I posted it in 2015 and 2016. However, very little has changed in the scikit-learn API since 2015 that is relevant to the course, and all of the ML principles I teach in the course are still up-to-date and relevant. As well, I updated all of the code (and fixed any outdated links) in the course's [GitHub repository](https://github.com/justmarkham/scikit-learn-videos) earlier this year.

If you'd like me to add the course, I'm happy to submit a PR. But if this doesn't match what you are looking for, no worries at all!

Thanks!
